prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Who specifically was Stefan communicating with in WhatsApp at 3:34 AM, in his local time zone this morning, that was not me?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection), Suzanne by the Ascendant's 4th house (Stefan's 7th), and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is the compiled chart data for this specific horary inquiry, using only established horary principles for careful analysis:

1. Query Framework and Entity Representation
 • Question: Who specifically was Stefan communicating with via WhatsApp at 3:34 AM (Stefan’s local time) that is not Melissa?
 • Representations (by provided house mapping):
  – Melissa is represented by the Ascendant (1st house in her chart).
  – Suzanne (Stefan’s wife) is represented by the Ascendant’s 4th house (corresponding to Stefan’s 7th house).
  – Stefan’s communication partner—the one we must identify—is indicated by the Ascendant’s 9th house (Stefan’s 12th house, a domain often linked to foreign or hidden exchanges).
 • House X-Reference Key (for Stefan):
  – Ascendant’s 9th House ⇨ Stefan’s 12th House

2. Planetary Positions (as provided)
 • Sun: 17° Aquarius
 • Moon: 21° Taurus
 • Mercury: 14° Aquarius
 • Venus: 0°59′ Aries
 • Mars (retrograde): 19° Cancer
 • Jupiter: 11°16′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 17°56′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°16′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°6′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°12′ Aquarius
 • North Node (retrograde): 29°36′ Pisces
 • Chiron: 19°38′ Aries
 • Ascendant: 18°27′ Taurus
 • Midheaven (MC): 27°21′ Capricorn
 • IC: 27°21′ Cancer

3. House Cusps and Planetary Placements
 • 1st House (Starts at 18° Taurus): Contains Moon, Jupiter, and Uranus
 • 2nd House (Starts at 20° Gemini)
 • 3rd House (Starts at 9° Cancer): Contains Mars
 • 4th House (Starts at 27° Cancer)
 • 5th House (Starts at 20° Leo)
 • 6th House (Starts at 29° Virgo)
 • 7th House (Starts at 18° Scorpio)
 • 8th House (Starts at 20° Sagittarius)
 • 9th House (Starts at 9° Capricorn)        [Key for Stefan’s inquiry]
 • 10th House (Starts at 27° Capricorn): Contains Sun, Mercury, and Pluto
 • 11th House (Starts at 20° Aquarius): Contains Saturn and Neptune
 • 12th House (Starts at 29° Pisces): Contains Venus, North Node, and Chiron

4. Major Aspects (with orbs as noted)
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Neptune Sextile MC (orb: 1°)
 • Saturn Sextile Ascendant (orb: 1°)
 • Mars Sextile Ascendant (orb: 1°)
 • Sun Square Ascendant (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Trine IC (orb: 1°)
 • North Node Sextile MC (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 2°)
 • Moon Sextile Mars (orb: 2°)
 • Sun Sextile Chiron (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Conjunction Neptune (orb: 2°)
 • Moon Conjunction Uranus (orb: 2°)
 • North Node Trine IC (orb: 2°)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Venus Sextile MC (orb: 3°)
 • Moon Conjunction Ascendant (orb: 3°)
 • Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 3°)
 • Venus Trine IC (orb: 3°)
 • Mercury Trine Jupiter (orb: 3°)
 • Uranus Sextile IC (orb: 4°)
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Moon Sextile Saturn (orb: 4°)
 • Mercury Square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Sun Square Moon (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus Trine MC (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Mercury Sextile Chiron (orb: 5°)
 • Pluto Opposition IC (orb: 5°)
 • Pluto Conjunction MC (orb: 5°)
 • Uranus Conjunction Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Moon Sextile IC (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Sun Square Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Moon Trine MC (orb: 6°)
 • Sun Trine Jupiter (orb: 6°)
 • Moon Square Mercury (orb: 7°)
 • Mars Opposition MC (orb: 8°)
 • Mars Conjunction IC (orb: 8°)

5. Notable Patterns and Special Features
 • Multiple Planet Square: Involving Mercury (14° Aquarius), the Ascendant (18° Taurus), Moon (21° Taurus), Sun (17° Aquarius), and Uranus (23° Taurus) – indicating fixed assertions and tensions between communication and personal identity.
 • Cradle Pattern: Formed by Mars (19° Cancer), MC (27° Capricorn), Neptune (28° Pisces), Uranus (23° Taurus), and IC (27° Cancer) – emphasizing the interplay between public matters and deeply hidden influences.
 • Additional Structural Notes:
  – The Moon is a first-quarter moon.
  – The overall chart adopts a Bowl shape, with a dominant Fixed mode among many inner planets.
  – The lower right quadrant (relative to the MC-IC axis) is sparse, suggesting emphasis on particular areas.
  – An emphasis on left-hemisphere placements among inner planets.

This collection of data will serve as the foundation for determining the nature of the WhatsApp communication as indicated in the query.

 • Mars Conjunction IC (orb: 8°)

5. Notable Patterns and Special Features
 • Multiple Planet Square: Involving Mercury (14° Aquarius), the Ascendant (18° Taurus), Moon (21° Taurus), Sun (17° Aquarius), and Uranus (23° Taurus) – indicating fixed assertions and tensions between communication and personal identity.
 • Cradle Pattern: Formed by Mars (19° Cancer), MC (27° Capricorn), Neptune (28° Pisces), Uranus (23° Taurus), and IC (27° Cancer) – emphasizing the interplay between public matters and deeply hidden influences.
 • Additional Structural Notes:
  – The Moon is a first-quarter moon.
  – The overall chart adopts a Bowl shape, with a dominant Fixed mode among many inner planets.
  – The lower right quadrant (relative to the MC-IC axis) is sparse, suggesting emphasis on particular areas.
  – An emphasis on left-hemisphere placements among inner planets.

This collection of data will serve as the foundation for determining the nature of the WhatsApp communication as indicated in the query.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Reviewing the horary chart within the established framework, I note the following:

1. The query is defined by three representations: Melissa at the Ascendant, Suzanne by the Ascendant’s 4th house (Stefan’s 7th), and the unknown communication partner by the Ascendant’s 9th house (corresponding to Stefan’s 12th). The 9th house clearly denotes foreign, secluded, or otherwise less personal contacts.

2. The planetary ruler of the 9th house—traditionally Saturn in Capricorn—is not visibly activating the house with a planet but shows its influence by its condition within the chart. Saturn’s condition here, along with its aspects, suggests a connection that is deliberate and measured, yet shrouded in some secrecy.

3. Mercury, the planet governing communication, positioned in Aquarius (14°) in the 10th house—and forming supportive aspects (its conjunction with the Sun and a trine to Jupiter)—hints at a message rendered with clarity but also with a touch of distance. Mercury’s influence, when viewed in this role, points toward an exchange that is not emotionally charged like Melissa’s (represented by the Moon in Taurus at the Ascendant) but analytical, perhaps even detached.

4. The chart’s emphasis on fixed Air (Sun, Mercury, and Pluto in Aquarius) and the arrangement of planets in the Bowl shape suggest a scenario where the request for clarity is met by a blend of innovative, sometimes unpredictable energy fused with long-term, sober wisdom. This combination indicates that the correspondent is not a transient flirtation or a warm family member (as Suzanne is clearly marked elsewhere) but someone of a more objective, perhaps professional or distant nature.

5. The Cradle pattern—linking Mars in Cancer, MC in Capricorn, Neptune in Pisces, and Uranus in Taurus along with the IC—reinforces the activation of hidden emotional undercurrents and potential urgencies behind unorthodox communications. Mars’ square to Chiron sharpens the painful, wound-related themes around the matter, suggesting that while this exchange is carried out in a practical medium (WhatsApp), it carries ramifications that might eventually expose underlying sensitivities in Stefan’s personal affairs.

6. Considering the positioning of the relevant houses, and noting that the 9th house questions matters of long-distance or foreign influences, the data indicate that the message did not come from anyone closely bound by immediate familial ties. Instead, the impression is of a contact whose background or social sphere lies outside Stefan’s immediate circle—a person whose character would align with measured, perhaps even austere energy as expressed by Saturn’s rulership. The practical nature of Mercury’s aspects emphasizes that this was not a spontaneous, affect-laden message but a carefully composed communication likely from a business or extended familial associate whose temperament is reserved and detached.

Based on the available chart factors—the absence of immediate emotional identification in the 9th house, the analytical clarity from Mercury, and the methodical tone imposed by Saturn’s influence—the clear indication is that Stefan’s WhatsApp message was directed to a foreign or distant associate, not one of his close partners. The qualities point to an individual operating from a professional, possibly long-established connection that is less familiar on a personal level. This person may well be linked to his extended family (beyond Suzanne and Melissa) or to professional obligations requiring discretion and moderate distance.

The synthesis of these factors leads me to conclude that the message emanates from that less personal sector of Stefan’s life—a contact whose energy is cool, deliberate, and associated with distant or foreign domains. Further detailed investigation (if additional data such as a secondary chart or follow-up question is provided) could refine the identity, but, for now, the reading confines itself to identifying the nature of the correspondent rather than a specific name.

Findings indicate that Stefan’s early-morning WhatsApp communication was with a person who embodies the detached professionalism and reserved demeanor characteristic of a foreign or extended connection, distinct from the intimate representations of himself (or Melissa and Suzanne).

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I just made these notes. Can you look and see if this is relevant? If I'm thinking of it correctly? I'm still trying to learn this method of Astrology.

saturn (stefan's ruling planet) is in Stefan's 2nd house:
- second house
  - money, work, daily routines, values, career


mercury conjunct sun in stefan's 1st house: 3 ° orb
- first house (Capricorn ruled - work ethic, long term goals, planning, and focus)
  - beginnings
  - self, identity
  - approach to life
  - contain's pluto
    - transformation
    - rebirth
  - contains the sun
    - leadership, authority, power, and influence
    - can also represent core identity or foundation

mercury trine jupiter in Stefan's 4th house: 3 ° orb
- fourth house (Taurus ruled - grounded, practical, patient)
  - roots, foundation
  - family
  - self-care
  - contains Uranus
    - change, innovation
    - individuality, freedom, pursuit of new ideas
    - unexpected surprises
  - contains Moon (his wife)
  - contains jupiter (r)
    - slow-down and/or revaluation
    - career, sprituality, relationships

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Your notes are on the right track. Saturn in Stefan's chart appearing in the 2nd house highlights pragmatism around money, routine, and values—which can mark communication being related to sustained practical concerns or professional matters. The Mercury–Sun conjunction in his 1st house, with its limited orb, underscores a period of clear, self-aware communication where personal identity and initiating efforts or beginnings are in focus. This aspect, especially when involving Pluto’s transformative energy, points to messages that carry a sense of personal redefinition or the assertion of authority in Stefan's self-expression.

Likewise, the Mercury trine Jupiter in the 4th house indicates that there is an element of expansion or blessing coming through from a place tied to family, roots, or long-established foundations. This can suggest that underlying the conversation are themes of structure and stability, or perhaps an unexpected familial or deeply ingrained matter coming to light.

Overall, your interpretation using these house placements is consistent with horary principles, capturing both the pragmatic influences (Saturn in the 2nd house) and the dynamic interplay between personal identity and foundational support (Mercury–Sun in the 1st and Mercury trine Jupiter in the 4th). These relationships in Stefan's chart offer a layered narrative that aligns well with the intended inquiry regarding the nature of his communication.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: So, it's either possible he was talking directly to his wife, who is in his fourth house, and potentially planning for a huge transformation, possibly divorce, or he was talking to his employer and making plans for a complete transformation of his career life. Which one of these makes most sense by what you see in the chart, because I'm still very much a novice here.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart factors, the evidence leans toward a professional or business-related conversation rather than an intimate, domestic one. The Mercury–Sun conjunction in the 1st house emphasizes a fresh, self-directed initiative that's less emotionally weighted, while the Mercury trine Jupiter influence in the 4th supports stable foundational matters rather than drastic, emotionally charged decisions like divorce. Additionally, Saturn's placement in the 2nd house underscores practical concerns—money, work, daily routines—that more commonly align with a career transformation than with personal relationship breakdown.

The energies indicate that the early-morning WhatsApp exchange is likely with an employer or a similarly distant contact who represents a pragmatic and strategically transformational force in Stefan's overall life, rather than his wife.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
leaning forward intently over the chart, my rings catching the candlelight as I trace the aspects with my finger

My dear, your instincts serve you well, but let me illuminate what the stars reveal most strongly. The placement of the Moon (representing Suzanne) in Stefan's 4th house, conjoined with Uranus, speaks volumes. This conjunction, particularly with Uranus's disruptive energy, suggests sudden changes or revelations within the domestic sphere.

What's most telling is Mars retrograde in Cancer making that precise square to Chiron - this speaks of deep wounds and painful communications being revisited. With Mars opposing the Midheaven and conjunct the IC, we're seeing a fundamental shake-up of both home and public life.

The Venus-Neptune conjunction in the 12th house is particularly revealing - it suggests secrecy and potential deception around relationships. This, combined with Mercury's aspects, points more strongly toward marital communications than career ones.

tapping the chart decisively

The chart screams of domestic upheaval rather than career transformation. While both scenarios are technically possible, the emotional intensity of the water signs involved and the prominence of relationship-oriented planets in sensitive houses makes it far more likely this was a conversation with Suzanne about their marriage.

The presence of Pluto at the Midheaven suggests this transformation will eventually become public knowledge, but for now, it's being handled privately through these early morning messages.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Horary: Who was Stefan talking to in WhatsApp at 3:34 AM this morning. Likely his employer or someone work related.
